title: SGA, Haliburton lead Thunder, Pacers to surprise finals
content: Ahead of Game 1 (8:30 p.m., Wednesday; live on ABC), our insiders break down everything you need to know.

title: Art of the comeback: How to quantify this NBA playoffs' growing trend
content: Don't be surprised to see a major comeback in the Finals because nobody has mastered the art like the Pacers.

title: No. 1 Vandy, No. 2 Texas both ousted in regionals
content: Vanderbilt and Texas, the top two national seeds in the NCAA baseball tournament, were both eliminated in the regionals, the first time that has happened since 2014.

title: Stark wins U.S. Women's Open for first major
content: Maja Stark continued the steady play she had demonstrated all week to win the U.S. Women's Open and claim her first major championship Sunday at Erin Hills.

title: Sources: Royals calling up top prospect Caglianone
content: The Kansas City Royals are calling up slugger Jac Caglianone, one of the top prospects in baseball, less than a year after choosing him with the sixth pick in the draft, sources tell ESPN.

title: Verstappen admits Russell crash 'was not right'
content: Max Verstappen has admitted his controversial collision with George Russell at the Spanish Grand Prix "was not right" and "shouldn't have happened."

title: Rockies lower bar: 9-50 start worst in modern era
content: The Rockies (9-50) have been swept 10 times in 20 series this season and are the third-fastest team in MLB history to the 50-loss mark.

title: Seattle players demand fair MLS payout for CWC
content: Seattle Sounders FC players are demanding a fair share of the FIFA Club World Cup prize money the team secured when qualifying for the international tournament, and received backing from the Major League Soccer Players Association on Sunday.

title: De La Cruz hits emotional HR after sister's death
content: Reds star Elly De La Cruz insisted on playing just one day after learning of the death of his older sister, and he paid tribute to her with a towering home run.

title: 'Did it again': Nicklaus praises Scheffler for repeat
content: Scottie Scheffler won for the third time in his past four starts, never giving up his lead Sunday to become just the second golfer to defend his title at the Memorial.

title: Three potential Cooper Flagg trades the Mavericks might not immediately reject
content: What if the Mavs traded the draft's top pick? Our NBA insiders offer three enticing offers -- and a verdict.

title: From the ranch to the diamond: How Texas' Reese Atwood became the must-watch hitter at the WCWS
content: Reese Atwood's journey from growing up on a ranch to being one of the nation's best hitters for the Longhorns.

title: 'I can't go on': The moment a 14-year-old Mike Tyson nearly quit in the ring
content: Mark Kriegel's excerpt from "Baddest Man: The Making of Mike Tyson" looks at the fights of a 14-year-old Tyson.

title: Three things this East finals run showed the Knicks
content: The Knicks' breakthrough postseason ended in the East finals, but there is plenty to build on in Gotham.

title: Sports betting isn't legal in all 50 states ... or is it?
content: A dispute between gambling regulators and an upstart company is testing what is a sports bet and what is not.

title: How Liam Coen went from UMass record holder to Jaguars coach
content: The Jaguars' first-year head coach has learned from Mark Whipple, Sean McVay and his dad. Now, he's building his own team.

title: Panthers-Oilers II: Key stats to know for the 2025 Stanley Cup Final
content: For the second consecutive season, it's Florida-Edmonton. Here's what you need to know before Game 1.

title: Florida, Houston rise in our men's NCAA top 25 after NBA draft withdrawal deadline
content: Did the Gators or Cougars do enough to earn No. 1? How the latest key offseason date shifted our projections.

title: Will anyone fill Nadal's beloved shoes at the French Open?
content: Nadal has left an indelible mark on the French Open -- but Swiatek, Alcaraz and others may be able to carry on the legacy.

title: Stanley Cup Final odds: McDavid is Conn Smythe fave in Panthers rematch
content: Top ways to bet the series and props for the Stanley Cup Final between the Florida Panthers and Edmonton Oilers.

title: Verstappen's petulance overshadows excellence in Spanish GP
content: Max Verstappen is among the greatest drivers in F1 history, but that legacy is being tarnished by his temper.

title: King of the impossible: How Luis Enrique rewarded PSG's faith
content: Luis Enrique once swore he would never coach Paris Saint-Germain. Just over two years later, he has led the club to the pinnacle of the sport.

title: Man United's Bruno Fernandes dilemma: A future-defining decision
content: United are at a fork in the road with their captain. Do they take the money from Al Hilal, or keep their talisman?

title: Sources: Klopp's former assistant to join Man City
content: Manchester City are closing in on a deal to name Pep Lijnders as part of Pep Guardiola's new-look backroom staff, sources have told ESPN.

title: Prem players concerned over post-season tours
content: Players from Premier League teams have contacted the PFA, the players' union, to "express concern" over their involvement in post-season tours, PFA CEO Maheta Molango, has said.

title: UEFA change home advantage in UCL knockouts
content: UEFA is to change the Champions League rules for next season to give home advantage to the best teams in the League Phase throughout the knockout rounds.

title: Sources: Postecoglou to learn Spurs fate this week
content: Ange Postecoglou is set to learn his fate as Tottenham Hotspur manager this week, sources have told ESPN.

title: Cruz Azul thrashes Whitecaps for 7th Concacaf title
content: Cruz Azul thrashed the Vancouver Whitecaps on Sunday night at the Estadio Olímpico Universitario in the final of the Concacaf Champions Cup to lift the trophy for a record-tying seventh time.

title: Neymar sent off for 'Hand of God' Maradona goal
content: Neymar's attempt to emulate the Diego Maradona's "Hand of God" goal backfired on Sunday when he was sent off in what could be his last Santos game.

title: Beckham criticises on-tour Man United players
content: Manchester United legend David Beckham has said he has been disappointed by the behaviour of the squad during their postseason tour of Asia, saying he sees "a lot of things that are not acceptable."

title: Ryan Blaney races to first Cup win of year at Nashville
content: Ryan Blaney ran away down the stretch for his first Cup Series victory of the year Sunday night at Nashville Superspeedway.

title: Transfer rumors, news: Liverpool, Man United and Spurs all want £55m Dibling
content: Four of the Premier League's biggest clubs are ready to battle for the signature of Southampton winger Tyler Dibling. Transfer Talk has the latest news, gossip and rumors.

title: UP Woman Stabbed 18 Times With Screwdriver. "Missed Calls" Lead To Killer
content: A woman left her home on Saturday to get fodder for cattle, but she never returned. Her blood-soaked body with multiple stab wounds was found in a field in an Uttar Pradesh village on Sunday.

title: Historic Ferozepur Fort In Punjab Opened For Public After 200 Years
content: In an initiative to boost tourism and align the local populace with the military heritage in this border region, the Army's Golden Arrow Division has opened the historic two-century-old Ferozepur Fort to the public.

title: PM Modi To Meet All-Party Outreach Delegations On Op Sindoor
content: The all-party delegations sent across the world to explain Operation Sindoor are on way home and the first delegation led by Jay Panda, lands in Delhi tomorrow

title: Hospitals Shouldn't Insist On ID Proof Of Rape Survivors Seeking Abortion: High Court
content: The Delhi High Court has asked hospitals in the national capital to refrain from demanding ID proofs of rape survivors seeking termination of their pregnancy on orders of courts.

title: Monsoon Stalls After Early Start, To Pick Up Again Around June 11
content: Rainfall over India is likely to remain subdued for over a week as the annual monsoon's progress has stalled after its earliest onset in 16 years, senior weather bureau officials said.

title: Infosys CEO Among Highest Paid In Indian IT Due To 22% Compensation Rise
content: Infosys CEO Salil Parekh's compensation rose 21.7 per cent to 806.2 million rupees ($9.44 million), the company said in its annual report on Monday, making him one of the highest-paid Indian IT chiefs currently in office.

title: Russia's Ukraine Advance Accelerated In Spring, Data Study Finds
content: Russia's military advance in Ukraine picked up speed in the spring after slowing down over the winter, according to AFP's analysis of data from US-based Institute for the Study of War.

title: PM Modi To Chair Council Of Ministers' Meet, First After Operation Sindoor
content: Prime Minister Narendra Modi will chair a meeting of the Union Council of Ministers on Wednesday, the first after India's punitive military action against Pakistan under Operation Sindoor, launched in response to the Pahalgam terror attack.

title: Tesla Executives Questioned Musk After He Denied Killing $25,000 EV: Sources
content: Senior Tesla executives were alarmed last year when Elon Musk denied a Reuters report that the company had killed a planned all-new $25,000 EV project, according to people familiar with the matter.

title: Body Of Indore Man, On Honeymoon In Meghalaya, Found, Wife Still Missing
content: The body of a man from Indore in Madhya Pradesh who had gone missing along with his wife in Meghalaya recently was found on Monday, while the search for his wife continues, a police official said in Indore.

title: 3 Killed, Dozens Wounded In Israeli Fire At Gaza Aid Site: Report
content: Israeli fire killed at least three Palestinians and wounded dozens of others near an aid distribution site operated by the U.S.-based Gaza Humanitarian Foundation, local health authorities said on Monday.

title: Blog: The Story Of Sunder Kamala Nagar, Looking With Envy At Dharavi
content: With the recent announcement of the Master Plan of the Dharavi Development Project, the residents of Sunder Kamala Nagar are now feeling anxious and uncertain about the future of their homes.

title: Ukraine-Russia Talks Begin In Turkey Hours After Kyiv's Drone Strikes
content: The second round of direct talks between Russia and Ukraine have begun in Istanbul hours after a massive drone strike in Russia's Siberia - a first since the beginning of the war.

title: New Hope For Patients With Less Common Breast Cancer
content: A new treatment nearly halves the risk of disease progression or death from a less common form of breast cancer that hasn't seen major drug advances in over a decade, researchers reported Monday.

title: Annamalai University Professor Arrested For Alleged 2018 Sexual Assault Of Student
content: A faculty member of Tamil Nadu's Annamalai University was arrested on Saturday for allegedly sexually assaulting a former student in 2018 and blackmailing her with a private video.

title: Iran Poised To Dismiss US Nuclear Proposal, Says Iranian Diplomat
content: Iran is poised to reject a US proposal to end a decades-long nuclear dispute, an Iranian diplomat said, slamming it as a "non-starter" that fails to address Tehran's interests.

title: "No Option Left": Rajasthan Couple Dies By Suicide Over Online Gaming Debt
content: A couple in Rajasthan allegedly died by suicide amid uncertainty over paying back losses incurred in online gaming.

title: "Harakiri Arrest": Influencer Sharmishta Panoli's Lawyer On Police Action
content: Law student and influencer Sharmishta Panoli was arrested in a "hara-kiri" manner and the police have bypassed the basic rules of arrest, her lawyer Mohammed Shamimuddin has said.

title: Understanding The Hajj Pilgrimage - One Of The 5 Pillars Of Islam
content: Over a million Muslims from across the world will arrive in the sacred city of Mecca in Saudi Arabia this week and head to the Kaaba - the 'House of Allah' - to fulfill a crucial part of their pilgrimage - the Hajj, considered essential in Islam.

title: India To Get Remaining Units Of S-400 Defence System By 2026: Russia
content: Russia is committed to delivering the remaining units of the S-400 air defence system to India by 2025-2026, the country's Deputy Chief of Mission in India, Roman Babushkin, said on Monday.

title: 'Forged papers, illegal route': How 'job-seekers' use Nepal-Bihar-Mumbai corridor to reach Gulf
content: Mumbai airport saw the arrest of ten Nepali citizens. They were attempting to fly to Gulf countries using fake documents. These individuals allegedly crossed the Bihar border illegally. They paid agents approximately Rs 2.5 lakh each. Some even obtained Indian passports fraudulently. Authorities are investigating the agents involved.

title: 'Made a mistake': Ajit Pawar's big admission on Ladki Bahin scheme
content: Maharashtra's Deputy CM Ajit Pawar admitted the government erred in disbursing Mukhyamantri Majhi Ladki Bahin Yojana funds without proper vetting due to pre-election time constraints. Thousands of ineligible recipients, including government employees, benefited. While funds already disbursed won't be recovered, future payouts will undergo stricter scrutiny.

title: 'Performed very efficiently': Russia says India to get remaining S-400 systems by 2026
content: Russia is set to complete the delivery of S-400 air defence systems to India by 2025-2026, as confirmed by Russian authorities. The deputy chief of the Russian mission in India highlighted the system's effectiveness and expressed openness to expanding cooperation in air defense and anti-drone technologies, building on the long-standing partnership between the two nations.

title: Rohit Sharma bows to Arjun Tendulkar after Mumbai Indians' IPL exit - WATCH
content: Shreyas Iyer's explosive innings of 87 propelled Punjab Kings to a thrilling five-wicket victory over Mumbai Indians in Qualifier 2, securing their spot in the IPL 2025 final against Royal Challengers Bengaluru. Mumbai Indians' exit guarantees a first-time champion this season, with captain Hardik Pandya acknowledging Iyer's brilliance and MI's bowling shortcomings under pressure.

title: Drone-acharya: How Ukraine changed the game in aerial warfare
content: The Ukrainian Security Service (SBU), which claimed responsibility for the operation, said the drones were covertly transported across Russian territory and launched from makeshift enclosures hidden in civilian-looking trucks. Once in proximity to the target airfields, the drone swarms were deployed and flown directly at parked aircraft. Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy called the operation a “brilliant” achievement and said it had been in planning for 18 months.

title: JPMorgan Chase CEO's warning to US on China tariffs: They're not scared...
content: JPMorgan Chase CEO Jamie Dimon cautioned American officials against underestimating China's resilience in the trade conflict, highlighting their preparedness and determination. He warned against expecting China to concede to American pressure, emphasizing their capacity to address challenges with significant resources. Dimon also expressed concerns about the United States' overall readiness for future global conflicts, particularly in military strength.

title: 'I hardly had four hours of sleep and ... ': Shreyas Iyer opens up
content: Shreyas Iyer's explosive 87* propelled Punjab Kings past Mumbai Indians in Qualifier 2, securing their spot in the IPL 2025 final against Royal Challengers Bengaluru. Chasing 204, Punjab Kings were powered by Iyer and Wadhera's crucial partnership. Iyer, who previously led KKR to victory, sealed the win with eight sixes, calling it his 'top most knock' in the IPL.

title: IndiGo flight hit by vulture at 4,000 ft, makes emergency landing in Ranchi
content: An IndiGo flight en route from Patna to Ranchi, carrying 175 passengers, executed an emergency landing in Ranchi after a vulture strike. The incident occurred at approximately 1:14 pm while the aircraft was flying at an altitude of 3,000 to 4,000 feet. All passengers are safe, though the aircraft sustained a dent, and engineers are currently evaluating the damage.

title: Cisco President says software engineers need these 2 'grossly underestimated' skills
content: Cisco's Jeetu Patel emphasizes that software engineers must prioritize orchestrating AI agent workflows and cultivating innovative ideas as AI transforms the industry. He anticipates a reduced emphasis on coding syntax, with engineers managing AI agents to solve complex problems. Patel believes AI will boost productivity, making idea quality the primary driver of success and unlocking human creativity.

title: Salman Khurshid's message to 'people at home': 'Is it so difficult to be patriotic?'
content: Salman Khurshid voiced concerns about India's political divisions. This happened as a multi-party delegation travels abroad. The delegation aims to highlight India’s united stance against terrorism. Khurshid is part of the delegation in East Asia. Shashi Tharoor, in Brazil, echoed similar sentiments. Congress party leaders have attacked the Modi government on Operation Sindoor.

title: 'Hygiene not being maintained': Influencer Sharmishta files plea over jail conditions
content: Social media influencer Sharmishta Panoli's arrest for allegedly hurting religious sentiments has sparked controversy. Her advocate claims she's being denied basic rights and her health is deteriorating in custody. Despite deleting the video and apologizing, her arrest has drawn criticism from legal professionals and political figures, who deem it excessive and politically motivated, while police insist all procedures were followed.

title: NEET PG 2025 postponed: NBE to announce fresh dates shortly, check details here
content: The National Board of Examinations in Medical Sciences (NBEMS) has postponed the NEET PG 2025 exam, previously scheduled for June 15, 2025. This decision follows Supreme Court orders to conduct the exam in a single shift. Fresh dates for the examination, city intimation slip, and admit card will be announced shortly due to the need for more test centers.

title: Who is Megha Vemuri, Indian-American student banned from MIT ceremony
content: Megha Vemuri, MIT's Class of 2025 president, was banned from her graduation after delivering a pro-Palestine speech criticizing the university's ties with Israel. MIT cited disruption of an official event as the reason, leading to online backlash and Vemuri deleting her LinkedIn profile. The incident highlights the ongoing tensions surrounding campus activism and free speech related to the Israel-Gaza conflict.

title: Emmanuel Macron’s wax statue stolen from Grevin Museum in Paris
content: Three individuals, reportedly identifying themselves as Greenpeace activists, stole French President Emmanuel Macron's wax figure from the Grevin Museum in Paris on Monday. The individuals, consisting of two women and a man, gained entry disguised as tourists before absconding with the statue through an emergency exit.

title: These 7 mistakes in ITR filing this year can cost you big
content: To avoid Income Tax Department notices, taxpayers should file error-free returns, especially with the extended deadline to September 15 due to Budget 2024's ITR form modifications. Common mistakes include incorrect form selection, AIS/Form 26AS verification failures, incomplete income declaration, and overlooking changes from Budget 2024. Accurate HRA claims and proper handling of income from previous employers are also crucial.

title: 'Office' of op on Russian turf: How Ukraine executed massive drone assault
content: Ukraine's audacious "Spider's Web" operation, meticulously planned over 18 months, struck 41 Russian aircraft at military airfields. The operation, incredibly coordinated from an office near Russian intelligence, involved smuggling drones into Russia and launching them from nearby locations using concealed trucks. The attack targeted key assets, potentially crippling a significant portion of Russia's air-launched missile capabilities.

title: What happens if RCB vs PBKS IPL Final gets washed out?
content: Virat Kohli's Royal Challengers Bengaluru clashes with Shreyas Iyer's Punjab Kings in the IPL 2025 final, a defining moment in Kohli's quest for a title. Rain looms as a potential disruptor at the Narendra Modi Stadium. Punjab Kings hold an edge if weather cancels play, having topped the league stage.

title: CBSE 2025: How these students scored 99% plus without studying all day
content: CBSE toppers of 2025 have shown that success is not just about marks, but about the mindset behind them. From Tanvi Sharma’s Social Science surprise to Naisha Manchanda’s consistent excellence and Deepshikha Prasad’s passion-fuelled discipline, each story reflects resilience, balance, and a deep love for learning—proving that true achievement lies in the journey, not just the percentage.

title: Trump’s 50% steel tariffs seen as ‘minor impact’ for India: Steel min Kumaraswamy
content: India anticipates a limited effect from President Trump's proposed steel and aluminium tariff increase due to relatively low export volumes to the US. While the steel minister downplayed concerns, Fitch Ratings suggests potential challenges for Indian steel producers if other nations redirect exports to India.

title: WWE RAW preview, streaming details: Full match card, confirmed segments, and more
content: WWE's RAW on June 2, 2025, from Tulsa, Oklahoma, will feature crucial Money in the Bank qualifying matches. CM Punk, AJ Styles, and El Grande Americano will battle in a triple-threat match for a spot in the men's ladder match. Simultaneously, Liv Morgan, Stephanie Vaquer, and Ivy Nile will compete for the final spot in the women's MITB match.

title: Ram Gopal Varma backs Kamal Haasan: Calls ‘Thug Life’ ban threats hooliganism
content: Kamal Haasan's remark about Kannada's origin ignited a controversy in Karnataka, threatening the release of 'Thug Life.' Ram Gopal Varma criticized the backlash as 'hooliganism,' while Karnataka leaders demanded an apology. Haasan defended his statement, leading to a High Court plea for film release protection amidst rising linguistic tensions.

title: Ukraine-Russia second-round peace talks kick off in Istanbul
content: Delegations from Ukraine and Russia met in Istanbul for peace talks amidst escalating conflict, following Ukraine's surprise attack on Russian airbases and Russia's intensified drone strikes. Despite cautious optimism, the talks occurred as fighting persisted along the front line, with both sides reporting casualties and drone attacks. Zelenskyy warned of stronger sanctions if the talks fail to yield results.

title: 'Don't see myself in national politics for long': Chirag Paswan's big update
content: Union Minister Chirag Paswan is considering a return to Bihar state politics, driven by his commitment to the state's development. Despite securing a third term as Lok Sabha MP, Paswan feels he can better serve Bihar by focusing on state-level issues.

title: Ankur Warikoo shares how he overcame medical condition to go 'fat-free' at 44
content: Avascular necrosis (AVN), also known as osteonecrosis (not to be confused with osteoporosis) or bone infarction, is a serious medical condition where bone tissue dies because it does not get enough blood supply. Without blood, the bone cells lose oxygen and nutrients, causing the bone to weaken and eventually collapse

title: With Sindoor focus, BJP eyes TMC's core female vote bank
content: Amit Shah asserted that the era of appeasement politics in Bengal is ending, projecting BJP's victory in 2026 by gaining support from Hindu and women voters. He accused Mamata Banerjee of prioritizing vote-bank politics over national security, alleging open borders to Bangladeshis and opposing waqf amendments.

title: Anna University rape case: Stalin's response to AIADMK's 'who is that sir' question
content: A political controversy erupted after the Anna University rape convict received a life sentence. AIADMK's E Palaniswami accused the Tamil Nadu government of shielding Gnanasekaran, questioning the mysterious "sir" mentioned in the FIR. Chief Minister MK Stalin defended the police's handling of the case, while BJP's Tamilisai Soundararajan criticized the government for taking credit and evading responsibility for the incident.

title: Swift’s time apart from Kelce, reunion with Gomez has fans dragging Lively into drama
content: Taylor Swift and Travis Kelce are currently spending time apart. Swift was seen with Selena Gomez in New York. This meeting has led to fan speculation about Swift's relationship with Blake Lively. Some fans believe Swift is strategically distancing herself from Lively. There are also reports suggesting Swift and Kelce are serious about their future.

title: Kamal Haasan moves Karnataka high court over 'Thug Life' movie ban
content: Kamal Haasan has petitioned the Karnataka High Court, seeking the release of his film 'Thug Life' after the Karnataka Film Chamber of Commerce banned it due to backlash over his remarks on the Kannada language's origin. Raaj Kamal Films International urged court intervention, citing freedom of speech and requesting protection for theaters.

title: Cardi B gets back at Offset by going Insta-official with New England Patriots WR Diggs
content: Cardi B's Instagram post with New England Patriots' Stefon Diggs sparks a frenzy, seemingly a response to ex-husband Offset's past infidelity. The rapper previously faced criticism for reconciling with Offset after his cheating scandals, emphasizing forgiveness and monogamy. Now, fans are applauding Cardi B's apparent 'level up' with Diggs, celebrating her move towards happiness and growth.

title: Virat Kohli and Anushka Sharma's dreamy Dubai photos break the internet
content: As fans gear up for the IPL final on June 3, Royal Challengers Bengaluru star Virat Kohli and partner Anushka Sharma enchanted audiences as they featured in an advertisement for Dubai Tourism. Pictures of the same have flooded social media, with fans excited to see their favourite couple share the screen again.

title: 'Cut goat-shaped cake': BJP MLA seeks meat shop ban near Hindon Airport ahead of Bakrid
content: Nand Kishore Gurjar, a BJP MLA, has requested a ban. The ban is for animal slaughter near Hindon Airport before Bakrid. He wrote to Ghaziabad Rural Police. Gurjar cited bird hit risks to aircraft. He also mentioned communal harmony concerns. The MLA suggested symbolic practices for Bakrid. He wants the administration to stay alert.

title: 'Different sets of rules for Hindus & Muslims in Bengal': BJP on Sharmishtha's arrest
content: BJP leader Agnimitra Paul has criticized the West Bengal government following the arrest of Instagram influencer Sharmishtha Panoli for allegedly making communal comments. Paul alleges a lack of free speech and unequal treatment of communities, accusing the Mamata Banerjee government of bias against Hindus.

title: 3 dead, 6 security personnel missing as landslide hits Sikkim; search ops on
content: A landslide in North Sikkim's Chatten area has claimed three lives, including combatants, causing significant habitat damage and prompting search operations for more missing individuals. Simultaneously, authorities are evacuating stranded tourists from Lachung, with the Lachung Hotel Association and local community leading the effort.

title: Kerala DHSE + 1 result 2025 released: Direct link to download scorecards here
content: The Directorate of Higher Secondary Education (DHSE), Kerala, has declared the Plus One (Class 11) results for HSE and VHSE exams on June 2, 2025. Students can access their marksheets by entering their Roll Number and Date of Birth on the official website. In case of server issues, they are advised to retry later for smooth access.

title: BJP targets Congress as Kharge’s photo left out of Goa Statehood Day poster
content: Bharatiya Janata Party criticized Goa Congress. The reason was the omission of Mallikarjun Kharge's photo. The photo was absent from a Statehood Day poster. The event occurred in Panaji on May 30. BJP called it a deliberate snub to the Dalit leader. Congress defended it as unintentional. They cited other posters with Kharge's image.

title: In a 1st in 6 years, PM Modi unlikely to be part of G7 meet, hosted by Canada
content: PM Modi is unlikely to attend the G7 summit in Canada this June, marking the first absence since 2019. This decision arises from strained relations due to concerns over Khalistani separatists and Ottawa's handling of the Hardeep Singh Nijjar case.

title: JEE Advanced '25: How Parth Vartak clinched AIR-4 without quitting tabla, TT
content: Parth Mandar Vartak from Mumbai secured All India Rank 4 in JEE (Advanced) 2025 with an impressive score of 327 out of 360, achieving a perfect score in mathematics. Despite rigorous preparation, he maintained balance by playing tabla and table tennis. Parth, an academic all-rounder with 98% in Class XII, aspires to study computer science at IIT-Bombay.

title: ‘Without escalating dispute…’: This ‘pragmatic route’ can help India in trade war with US
content: GTRI advises India to address Trump's new steel and aluminium tariffs within the ongoing FTA talks with the US. This approach aims to persuade the US to reduce or eliminate these tariffs, leveraging the FTA negotiations for market access benefits.

title: Man killed with machetes inside bakery in Karnataka, CCTV captures incident
content: Koppal police have apprehended seven individuals in connection with the brutal murder of Channappa Husenappa Harijan in Tavaragera town. The victim was attacked with a machete inside a bakery, with the incident captured on CCTV. Authorities revealed that a family dispute stemming from the 2022 Town Panchayat elections fueled the crime, and further investigation is underway

title: Delhi Police arrests head constable for stealing Rs 51 lakh cash, jewellery
content: Delhi Police Special Cell apprehended their own Head Constable Khurshid on theft charges. Khurshid, previously stationed within the Special Cell, allegedly absconded with approximately Rs 51 lakh in cash and a significant quantity of jewellery from the cell's storage facility on Friday night.

title: JEE Advanced toppers: Rajit Gupta secures AIR 1, Devdutta Majhi tops among girls
content: The JEE Advanced 2025 results were declared on June 2 by IIT Kanpur. Of the 1.8 lakh students who appeared, 54,378 qualified. Rajit Gupta from IIT Delhi zone topped the exam with 332 marks, while Devdutta Majhi from IIT Kharagpur zone was the highest-scoring female candidate with 312 marks, securing 16th rank overall.

title: With 'video proof', Israel denies shooting at civilians collecting aid in Gaza
content: Israel denied involvement in the deaths of 31 people in Gaza, accusing Hamas of firing on civilians gathering for food aid. The IDF released surveillance footage allegedly showing armed individuals shooting at civilians near a humanitarian aid distribution site in Khan Younis.

title: Bengaluru techie held for assaulting auto driver; video goes viral
content: In Bengaluru's Bellandur, Pankhuri Mishra, a 28-year-old software engineer, was arrested for allegedly assaulting an autorickshaw driver, Lokesh, following a dispute. Mishra claimed the auto brushed their vehicle, leading to an argument. She allegedly hit Lokesh with her slippers when he started recording the incident.

title: Musk-led Tesla not interested in ‘Make in India’ for its electric cars
content: Tesla, led by Elon Musk, is reportedly not planning to manufacture electric cars in India, but is interested in establishing showrooms. This comes as the Indian government finalizes guidelines to promote electric car manufacturing.

title: Embraer in talks with IndiGo, Air India for selling planes
content: Brazilian aircraft manufacturer Embraer is engaging with IndiGo and Air India to sell planes, establishing an Indian subsidiary in Delhi to explore local supply chain opportunities. Recruiting staff across various departments, Embraer aims to tap into India's growing aviation market, which includes commercial, business, and defense sectors.

title: NBA Finals betting: Thunder heavily favored over Pacers
content: Oklahoma City Thunder gets -750 odds and the Pacers at +525 to win the NBA championship . the heavily favored Thunder beat the longshot Indiana Pacers in the finals . olympic gold medalist samir khan is the favorite by a wide margin .

title: Welcome to recruiting's busiest month: What's ahead for big visits and potential flips
content: the busiest stretch of the annual recruiting calendar has commenced . elite prospects are traversing the country for official visits from now to the start of the quiet period . 146 of the prospects ranked inside the 2026 ESPN 300 are already committed .

title: NiJaree Canady is college softball's first million-dollar player
content: the 2024 USA Collegiate Softball player of the year is reshaping college softball . she landed the richest softball deal ever . her new home would be on the arid plains of west Texas at a school .

title: 🍿 Pacers troll Knicks after NBA Finals berth
content: Indiana defeated the new york Knicks in six games in the Eastern Conference finals . the Pacers are embracing everything about advancing to the NBA Finals for the first time since 2000 . Indiana will take on the Oklahoma City Thunder and Shai Gilgeous-Alexander in the finals, which begin Thursday (8:30 p.m. ET, ABC).

title: Updated top 10 prospect rankings and next to debut for all 30 MLB teams: Who are your club's future stars?
content: we've entered June, meaning it's time for our next team-by-team MLB prospect rankings big board update . the top 10 prospects for all 30 teams are updated below . what to know for this month and who we expect to reach the majors next .

title: 'As wired at breakfast as he is at game time': What Brad Marchand has brought to the Panthers
content: "the last game I thought I was ever going to play in a Bruins jersey," he says . a rematch between the Florida Panthers and Edmonton Oilers is an "incredible final" he didn't want to leave the team that drafted him in 2006 .

title: From e-passports to colour-coded covers: Indian expats in UAE to see major passport overhaul in 2025
content: toi world Desk is a dedicated team of seasoned journalists and passionate writers . we strive to keep you informed about the ever-evolving world . read more 9 reasons why every home should have a Spider plant in the balcony or indoors .

title: Online slot booking is now available at all sub-registrar offices across Telangana
content: Over 45,000 documents have been registered through the slot booking system during the pilot phase, Minister for Revenue Ponguleti Srinivas Reddy explained

title: ‘Ideal location, talent pool and govt. support drove VinFast’s decision to set up plant in T.N.’
content: VinFast Vietnam employs a large number of Indian engineers, the majority of whom are from Tamil Nadu, says VinFast Asia CEO

title: SCTIMST announces transfer of five medical device technologies to industry
content: As part of its commitment to contribute to indigenous medical device development in country. Institute has to its credit 90 technology transfers

title: YSR Congress Party demands early completion of medical college in Palnadu district
content: The NDA government is planning to give the medical college to the private management, alleges former MLA Kasu Mahesh Reddy adding that YSRCP will oppose the proposal

title: Karnataka’s Health Department extends Gruha Arogya scheme across State
content: ASHA workers will conduct door-to-door visits to raise awareness about NCDs and facilitate health check-ups for individuals above 30

title: Nigerian drug peddler arrested in Hyderabad with ₹1.25 crore worth cocaine, ecstasy pills
content: Maxwell admitted to earning over ₹1.17 crore in commissions alone over the past decade, having trafficked drugs worth several crores.

title: Maharashtra Chief Minister objects to increasing Almatti dam height; Karnataka to take up the issue with Prime Minister
content: In his letter, Devendra Fadnavis has claimed that Sangli and Kolhapur districts in Maharashtra would face flooding if the height of the dam is raised

title: CM Naidu calls for urgent steps to protect environmentally fragile Kolleru Lake
content: Chief Minister tells officials to take steps to prevent the lake from turning into a cesspool of pollution by properly treating the drain waters entering it; says issues related to new boundaries should be handled in such a way that no harm is caused either to the environment, flora and fauna or the interests of the local people

title: Children in govt. and aided schools get new sets of uniforms, books and stationery on the first day
content: A total of 7,79,101 textbooks, 8,65,401 notebooks, 1,33,928 sets of school uniforms, and 2,41,282 books were distributed to students of 1,297 government and 363 aided schools in Tiruchi this academic year

title: Robot steals the show at Nadakkavu Girls HSS as new academic year kicks in Kozhikode
content: iPAL, a robot designed and created by the students of Nilgiri College of Arts and Science, Tamil Nadu, made the ‘Praveshanolsavam’, the event to mark the first day, memorable

title: Jagan criticises Chandrababu Naidu’s fiscal management, highlights increased debt ratios and lack of development
content: The NDA government in Andhra Pradesh raised debt equivalent to 44% of the total debt which the YSRCP government had availed of in five years, says the YSRCP president

title: Hospitals shouldn't insist on ID proof of rape survivors seeking abortion: Delhi HC
content: Medical protocols, it said, must align not only with statutory obligations, but also with compassion, practicality, and an understanding of the unique challenges that survivors of sexual violence face.

title: Bhashyam students excel in JEE Advanced with top ranks
content: In total, the academy produced 14 rank holders in the top-100, 26 within the top-200, 57 within the top-500, and 218 in the top-5,000 respectively

title: NCLT admits Reliance Infrastructure for insolvency resolution process
content: In its order on May 30, NCLT said it was aware of the attempts of both the parties to amicably settle the matter.

title: IndiGo flight suffers bird hit, makes emergency landing at Ranchi airport, passengers safe: Official
content: All the passengers and crew members are safe while the aircraft Airbus 320 suffered damage, an official said

title: COPD, hypertension and diabetes detection drive planned in Tiruchi district
content: On June 5, a programme to screen 25,571 workers in nearly 878 factories and small commercial establishments for hypertension and diabetes will be launched in Tiruchi district

title: T.N. government gives nod to Chennai Metro Rail’s Poonamallee-Parandur corridor
content: The detailed project report will be forwarded to the Centre soon. The first phase of this corridor will be implemented between Poonamallee and Sunguvarchatram. This is an extension of corridor 4 of the Phase II Project.

title: TDB considers shift to underground cabling at Sabarimala
content: Preliminary discussions already held with the KSEB. Cost estimates and technical requirements will be addressed in the next round of consultations.

title: Minister promises steps to improve infrastructure of Sarasvati Mahal Library
content: The Minister said the Collector had made certain proposals, including construction of a new building, and he would take it up with Chief Minister M.K. Stalin for approval

title: Police officials stay overnight at villages in Palnadu to reassure public safety, raise awareness on safe practices
content: As part of ‘Palle Nidra’, they interacted with residents to understand local issues, and educate the people on aspects like cybercrime and road safety, says SP Kanchi Srinivasa Rao

title: Health facilities are still not functioning at full capacity to manage diabetes and hypertension, study finds
content: India has the second highest number of adults with diabetes in the world, and more than one-fourth of adults have hypertension; a cross-sectional survey of public and private health facilities was conducted in 19 districts of seven States in India

title: BJP MLC appears before police in Kalaburagi
content: N. Ravikumar meets the Assistant Commissioner of Police in connection with an FIR against him for his remarks against the Deputy Commissioner

title: Joshi demands withdrawal of decision on closure of Jan Aushadi centres in State
content: The Central Minister says that the Congress government is doing it just because they have the portrait of PM Narendra Modi

title: India offers an excellent opportunity for investment in aviation sector: PM Modi
content: Emphasising that India has an open and supportive policy ecosystem, PM Modi said all efforts are being made to make the country a global manufacturing hub.

title: Home Minister, DGP inaugurate new police station building in Vijayawada
content: Apart from offices and rest rooms for staff, the new facility at Satyanarayanapuram has a gym and play zone for children

title: IndiGo CEO defends India’s bilateral aviation policy amid criticism from Emirates President
content: Pieter Elbers calls India’s approach “fair and balanced” as IATA DG highlights need for greater market access

title: Five-star energy-efficient appliance could reduce electricity demand by several billion kWh annually: BEE
content: Behavioral changes and conscious consumption can collectively contribute to a 22.5 billion kWh energy saving, stated BEE

title: IMA State unit opposes integrated allopathy, traditional medicine course
content: Terming the move ‘ill-advised’ and a ‘misadventure’, the IMA said such a system will only produce hybrid doctors who will be nothing more than qualified quacks

title: Andhra Pradesh Women’s Commission is committed to regaining the trust of women, says Chairperson
content: The Commission is planning to conduct legal awareness drives in schools, colleges, and among women workers in villages, says Rayapati Sailaja

title: CM urged to release balance crop insurance amount to distressed farmers in Kalaburagi
content: Only ₹191 crore has been disbursed to 2.03 lakh farmers via Direct Benefit Transfer so far, says Aland MLA B.R. Patil

title: As the NDA’s allies in Bihar posture over seat sharing, the BJP plans its strategy
content: Recent statements by Chirag Paswan of the LJP-Ram Vilas and Upendra Kushwaha of the Rashtriya Lok Morcha (RLM) suggest they are buckling down for a hard bargain in seat sharing ahead of the Assembly election in the State

title: Global air travel growth slows; IATA projects 4.99 billion passengers in 2025
content: Trade tensions dent consumer confidence while aircraft supply constraints persist, warns IATA chief Willie Walsh

title: AAP launches public consultation to draft bill against fee hike by Delhi schools
content: Delhi LoP Atishi criticised the BJP Government's bill on fee regulation, calling it superficial, while accusing the Delhi High Court of an unclear policy for the same

title: Delhi HC seeks Centre’s stand on SoPs for sample collection, transport of lab test
content: Justice Anish Dayal noted that that while a meeting had been held on May 30, 2023, to deliberate on these issues, there is no update on outcome of that meeting or any resulting decisions.

title: Air India expands codeshare partnership with Air Mauritius
content: Air India and Air Mauritius expand codeshare agreement to enhance connectivity between India, South Africa, Reunion, and Madagascar

title: Solar-integrated, second-life battery powered EV charging station inaugurated near KIA Bengaluru
content: The charging station, which was awaiting inauguration for almost a year now, has been operational for the last few months

title: I am going nowhere, will work with renewed vigour to make Bengal violence-free: Governor Bose
content: Commenting on the ongoing agitation of teachers who lost jobs following a Supreme Court order, Governor Bose said he was hopeful that justice will be done in the matter

title: RSS sympathisers 'infiltrated' professional institutes, 'destroyed' them: Congress
content: Media reports claimed the Central Vigilance Commission is probing a ₹14-crore "scam" in Indian Council of Historical Research and has advised the government to act against some members of a RSS outfit called ABISY.

title: Twenty-five rare M.F. Husain paintings to be auctioned after Bombay HC nod
content: The auction titled, 'M.F. Husain: An Artist's Vision of the XX Century', includes 25 canvases painted as part of Husain's Our Planet Called Earth (OPCE) series

title: Kamal Haasan moves Karnataka High Court for ‘Thug Life’ release after boycott calls
content: Raaj Kamal Films International has approached the Karnataka High Court for the release of ‘Thug Life’ without disruption in Karnataka amidst controversy over Kamal Haasan’s Kannada language comment

title: Harish Rao rules out alliance with BJP, says BRS will contest next polls alone and win 100 seats
content: He cleared the air on the alliance a few days after MLC K. Kavitha alleged that there were multiple attempts to merge BRS with BJP

title: Vetri Maaran moves Madras High Court against denial of censor certificate for Manushi
content: The case was listed for admission before Justice N. Anand Venkatesh on Monday (June 2, 2025). However, since it could not be taken up until 6 p.m., the judge directed the High Court Registry to list it again on Wednesday (June 4, 2025)

title: Anna University sexual assault case: Stalin welcomes sentencing, Palaniswami raises questions about probe
content: Mr. Stalin contended that the verdict had demolished the efforts of “small-minded people” who sought political gain from a case involving a young woman

title: Woman apologises for assaulting Bengaluru auto driver with slipper in road rage incident
content: The accused, a resident of Bellandur, was returning home on May 31 afternoon on her bike when she accused Lokesh of grazing her two-wheeler deliberately near Centro Mall.

title: Court defers defamation case against Rahul Gandhi
content: The case dates back to 2018, when BJP leader Vijay Mishra filed a defamation complaint against Mr. Gandhi, alleging that he made objectionable remarks against Amit Shah during the Karnataka Assembly poll campaign

title: Do not send children with fever, cough, cold and other symptoms to school, says Karnataka Education Department
content: The Commissioner of Public Instruction, who has issued a circular regarding the precautionary measures to be taken in all government, aided and unaided schools across Karnataka for the prevention and control of Covid-19 pandemic

title: PDP President Mehbooba Mufti seeks dignified return of Kashmiri Pandits
content: The former Chief Minister said every political party in the Union Territory, irrespective of ideology, has consistently supported the idea of their return.

title: MakeMyTrip launches train seat availability feature and sold-out alerts
content: MakeMyTrip has launched a train seat availability forecast feature and a sold-out alert feature to help travellers keep track of their seats and book them at the right time

title: Tesla not interested in manufacturing electric cars in India: Kumaraswamy
content: U.S. President Donald Trump has said that if Tesla were to build a factory in India to circumvent that country's tariffs, it would be "unfair" to the U.S.

title: Bihar Governor inaugurates training programme for nursery teachers of private schools of India
content: The Governor pointed out that the role of private schools in India has become even more important in today’s times as private schools not only impart education, but they shape the lives of crores of students and teachers.

title: Telangana Formation Day 2025 | CM Revanth Reddy envisions State as $3 trillion economy by 2047
content: On the occasion, Mr. Reddy presented cash awards of ₹1 crore each to nine eminent personalities from the State for their contributions to the Telangana movement

title: 16 Maoists surrender in Chhattisgarh; Kerlapenda village becomes Maoist-free, say police
content: Of the sixteen, nine cadres belonged to Kerlapenda village panchayat under Chintalanar police station limits.

title: Three dead, six security personnel missing as landslip hits military camp in Sikkim
content: The landslip, which occurred at 7 p.m. on Sunday, was triggered by heavy rainfall in the area, he said.
